pcs.cs: Physical pest control involves the trapping and killing or removal of pests to remove them from an environment. It may also involve putting up physical barriers and ‘pest proofing’ premises to stop pests from returning or entering in the first place.
Chemical pest control methods are the most widely used approach to pest control. They are also commonly used to control weed infestations and diseases in crops.

The biological method consists of using other natural organisms to reduce or remove a species of pest, which usually involves introducing their natural predator to the same environment to manage the pest population.
